newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B shares down at noon on cautious mood.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B shares down at noon on cautious mood.

text.p: Shanghai's B share index was down at midday on Thursday with investors concerned about the increasing possibility that the securities authoritives will take measures to cool down the markets, brokers said.
The B index fell 0.935 points or 0.95 percent to 97.271 points on volume of 13.686 million shares worth $9.844 million, compared with $12.788 million on Wednesday.
China's official newspapers have continued to publish articles warning of the risks of investment in the stock markets.
"Most domestic investors are worried that the B shares will tumble along with the A shares if the government takes measures to crackdown on the speculative A share markets," said one broker.

"More and more investors are blindly buying shares, and sooner or later Beijing will work out measures to curb the A share markets," said another broker. "The B share market will certainly be affected."
Of 43 B shares, 41 traded, with 26 down, six flat and nine up.
Wing Sung was the biggest loser on poor 1996 results, falling $0.018 or 5.99 percent to $0.282 on volume of 69,500 shares.
Market barometer Shanghai Lujiazui Finance & Trade Zone Development was the most actively traded on profit-taking, shedding $0.010 or 0.62 percent to $1.608 on volume of 1.8 million shares.
Shanghai's A share index tumbled on the same concerns, brokers said.
The index slipped 21.669 points or 1.39 percent to 1,540.981 on volume of 495.5 million shares worth 7.6 billion yuan.
The SSE30 blue chip index fell 68.812 points or 1.56 percent to 4,344.235 points.
Xiamen Engineering Machinery was the worst performer, dipping 0.58 yuan or 6.60 percent to 8.20 yuan on volume of 1.7 million shares.
